perturbation.original_text: 3.7 Invoices and Payment Terms. On delivery by Medica of a shipment of Cartridges in accordance with Section 3.3, Medica shall issue to Vapotherm an invoice for that shipment stating a price consistent with the terms of this Agreement. Vapotherm shall pay each such invoice in full within [* * *] Calendar Days from the date of invoice, unless Vapotherm has rejected the shipment in question in accordance with Section 4.2.
perturbation.changed_text: 3.7 Invoices and Payment Terms. On delivery by Medica of a shipment of Cartridges in accordance with Section 3.3, Medica shall issue to Vapotherm an invoice for that shipment stating a price consistent with the terms of this Agreement. Vapotherm shall pay each such invoice in full within [* * *] Calendar Days from the date of invoice, unless Vapotherm has rejected the shipment in question in accordance with Section 4.2. Notwithstanding the foregoing, Vapotherm may, at its sole discretion, elect to defer payment of any invoice for up to [* * *] Calendar Days from the date of invoice, subject to a late payment fee calculated as described in Section 3.8.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a conflict in payment terms. Section 3.7 initially states that invoices shall be paid within [* * *] Calendar Days. The addition allows Vapotherm to defer payment for up to [* * *] Calendar Days, creating uncertainty about the mandatory payment deadline.

perturbation.original_text: 3.8 Delay in Payment. Upon delay of payment beyond [* * *] days from invoice date, Medica at its' sole discretion may levy an increase to the net transfer price a [* * *]% per week to a maximum of [* * *]%.
perturbation.changed_text: 3.8 Delay in Payment. Upon delay of payment beyond [* * *] days from invoice date, Medica at its' sole discretion may levy an increase to the net transfer price a [* * *]% per week to a maximum of [* * *]%. However, if Vapotherm has elected to defer payment pursuant to Section 3.7, no such increase shall be levied until [* * *] days after the invoice date.
perturbation.explanation: This change creates a conflict in Section 3.8. The original text imposes a penalty for late payments beyond [* * *] days, while the addition exempts Vapotherm from this penalty if they have elected the deferral option outlined in the changed Section 3.7. This contradicts the initial strict timeline for penalties.

perturbation.original_text:
13.3 Effect of Termination.

(a) Upon any termination (including expiration) of this Agreement, each party shall return to the other party all documents and other tangible items to it or its employees or agents have received or created pursuant to this Agreement pertaining, referring, or relating to Confidential Information of the other party.

(b) Termination of this Agreement will not affect rights and obligations of either party that may have accrued prior to the date of termination or any other obligation contained in Section 5.5, 6.3, 6.4, 8.1, 8.3, Article 9, 10.1, 10.2, 10.3, 10.4, 10.5(b), 10.6, Article 12, Article 13, and Sections 14.3, 14.4, and 14.5. All rights and obligation decay after 2 (two) years from termination or expiration.

(c) Upon any termination (including expiration) of this Agreement, Vapotherm shall pay to Medica, and Medica shall pay to Vapotherm, all amounts payable up to the date of termination but not yet paid.

(d) The termination or expiration of this Agreement shall not relieve either party of its responsibility to comply in all material respects with any statutory or regulatory requirements associated with the System and/or the Cartridges.
perturbation.changed_text:
13.3 Effect of Termination.

(a) Upon any termination (including expiration) of this Agreement, each party shall return to the other party all documents and other tangible items to it or its employees or agents have received or created pursuant to this Agreement pertaining, referring, or relating to Confidential Information of the other party.

(b) Termination of this Agreement will not affect rights and obligations of either party that may have accrued prior to the date of termination or any other obligation contained in Section 5.5, 6.3, 6.4, 8.1, 8.3, Article 9, 10.1, 10.2, 10.3, 10.4, 10.5(b), 10.6, Article 12, Article 13, and Sections 14.3, 14.4, and 14.5. All rights and obligation decay after 2 (two) years from termination or expiration, unless otherwise agreed in writing by both parties at the time of termination.

(c) Upon any termination (including expiration) of this Agreement, Vapotherm shall pay to Medica, and Medica shall pay to Vapotherm, all amounts payable up to the date of termination but not yet paid.

(d) The termination or expiration of this Agreement shall not relieve either party of its responsibility to comply in all material respects with any statutory or regulatory requirements associated with the System and/or the Cartridges.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction regarding the decay of rights and obligations after termination. Section 13.3(b) initially states that all rights and obligations decay after 2 years from termination. The added clause introduces an exception: 'unless otherwise agreed in writing by both parties at the time of termination.' This creates ambiguity about whether the 2-year decay is a hard rule or subject to negotiation, making it an in-text contradiction.
